User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user within the Invoice Management System.

id.description: Unique identifier for the user entity.

email.description: The email address of the user.

firstName.description: The first name of the user.

lastName.description: The last name of the user.

role.description: The role of the user (e.g., Admin, Finance Team).

isActive.description: Indicates whether the user account is active.

definition.description: Stores user profile data. Includes fields for username, email, name, role and activity status. This collection uses path-based ownership for security. The `role` field is denormalized to simplify role-based access control in security rules. Access is restricted to users who are marked as `isActive`.

params.name: userId
params.description: The unique identifier for the user, corresponding to their Firebase Authentication UID.

firestore.reasoning: This Firestore structure prioritizes security and scalability for the Invoice Management System, adhering to Authorization Independence and QAP principles. User data is stored under `/users/{userId}` ensuring path-based ownership, which simplifies security rules. This structure avoids using `get()` calls in security rules, enabling atomic operations (transactions/batches) and improving debuggability by denormalizing the role to the `users` document. This structure uses segregation by using the path-based ownership approach which makes the structure more secure and easier to debug.
